revised_title: Proceedings of the Royal Society Meeting - November 17, 1898
tldr: This article reports on the papers presented at the Royal Society meeting on November 17, 1898. Topics discussed include the influence of removing the large intestine and increasing fat intake on dogs' metabolism, the impurity found in nitrogen gas derived from urea, further observations on snake venom toxins, and the sensory nerves of the eye muscles. Additionally, the electrical conductivity and luminosity of flames containing vaporized salts were studied.
